title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement codeofconduct@posit.co. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Leslie Huang. Author. Barret Schloerke. Contributor, maintainer. Leaflet Providers contributors. Contributor, copyright holder.            Leaflet Providers plugin Posit Software, PBC. Copyright holder, funder.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Huang L (2023). leaflet.providers: Leaflet Providers. https://rstudio.github.io/leaflet.providers/, https://github.com/rstudio/leaflet.providers.
code: @Manual{,   title = {leaflet.providers: Leaflet Providers},   author = {Leslie Huang},   year = {2023},   note = {https://rstudio.github.io/leaflet.providers/, https://github.com/rstudio/leaflet.providers}, }

title: Leaflet Providers
text: goal leaflet.providers provide regularly updated data third-party tile providers supported leaflet. data extracted leaflet-providers.js. leaflet.providers regularly released updated providers data, package comes functions use_providers() get_providers(), enable users fetch --date providers information directly leaflet-providers.js package updates load providers data leaflet. Users may also fetch older versions providers data leaflet-providers.js version number.

title: Leaflet Providers
text: can install released version leaflet.providers CRAN: development version GitHub :

title: Leaflet Providers
text: following basic example default providers data comes leaflet.providers well available methods fetch load custom providers.

title: Leaflet Providers
text: general, need load interact leaflet.providers directly. Instead, leaflet.providers used indirectly leaflet package leaflet::addProviderTiles() function.
code: library(leaflet)  leaflet()  |>   setView(lng = -71.0589, lat = 42.3601, zoom = 12) |>   addTiles() |>   addProviderTiles("OpenTopoMap")

title: Leaflet Providers
text: can choose specific version leaflet-providers.js calling use_providers() desired version providers desired version: Now use_providers() called custom leaflet.providers object obtained via get_providers() (case, previous version data), leaflet use custom providers instead default provider data. Note package V8 required get_providers().
code: # Shorthand method: use_providers("1.7.0")  # Longer method: # 1. Retrieve v 1.7.0 providers_170 <- get_providers("1.7.0")  # 2. Load custom providers data use_providers(providers_170)  # Reset loaded providers to default providers use_providers()

title: Fetch leaflet providers from Leaflet.js. — get_providers
code: if (   interactive() &&   requireNamespace("V8", quietly = TRUE) &&   requireNamespace("jsonlite", quietly = TRUE) ) {   get_providers()   get_providers("1.8.0") }

title: leaflet.providers: Leaflet Providers — leaflet.providers-package
text: Contains third-party map tile provider information 'Leaflet.js', https://github.com/leaflet-extras/leaflet-providers, used 'leaflet' R package. Additionally, 'leaflet.providers' enables users retrieve --date provider information package updates.

title: leaflet.providers: Leaflet Providers — leaflet.providers-package
text: Maintainer: Barret Schloerke barret@posit.co (ORCID) [contributor] Authors: Leslie Huang lesliehuang@nyu.edu contributors: Leaflet Providers contributors (Leaflet Providers plugin) [contributor, copyright holder] Posit Software, PBC [copyright holder, funder]

title: Use custom tile provider — use_providers

text: providers_info custom leaflet_providers object. NULL, uses default providers.

title: Use custom tile provider — use_providers
code: # \donttest{ if (require("V8") && require("jsonlite")) {   # Set providers to latest providers   use_providers(get_providers())    # Set providers to a custom providers object (specific version number)   use_providers(get_providers("1.4.0"))   use_providers("1.4.0") } #> Loading required package: V8 #> Using V8 engine 9.6.180.12 #> Loading required package: jsonlite # }

title: leaflet.providers (development version)
text: previous version (v1.13.0) leaflet.providers required R >= 3.6. versions R older 3.6 actively supported, theoretically supported minimum R version lower, likely R >= 2.10. ’ve restored previous R version minimum requirement. (#33) Updated leaflet.providers data 2023-10-05 https://unpkg.com/leaflet-providers using version 2.0.0 leaflet.js get_providers() default_providers() include stable htmltools::htmlDependency() dep slot returned object. default dependency uses static leaflet-providers.js file included leaflet.providers package, get_providers() dependency uses leaflet-providers.js file unpkg.com CDN. makes possible leaflet::addProviderTiles() use stable HTML dependency can cached knitr (#36).

title: leaflet.providers 1.13.0
text: CRAN release: 2023-08-10 Updated leaflet.providers data 2023-08-07 https://unpkg.com/leaflet-providers using version 1.13.0 leaflet.js
